name: Ext.draw.Surface
doc:
A surface is an interface to render sprites inside a draw container. The surface API has methods to render sprites, get sprite bounding boxes (dimensions), add sprites to the underlying DOM, and more.

A surface is automatically created when a draw container is created. By default, this will be a surface with an id of "main" and will manage all sprites in the draw container (unless the sprite configs specify a unique surface "id").

Ext.create({
    xtype: 'draw',
    renderTo: document.body,
    width: 400,
    height: 400,
    sprites: [{
        type: 'rect',
        surface: 'anim',  // a surface with id "anim" will be created automatically
        x: 50,
        y: 50,
        width: 100,
        height: 100,
        fillStyle: '#1F6D91'
    }]
});

The ability to have multiple surfaces is useful for performance (and battery life) reasons. Because changes to sprite attributes cause the whole surface (and all sprites in it) to re-render, it makes sense to group sprites by surface, so changes to one group of sprites will only trigger the surface they are in to re-render.

One of the more useful methods is the add method used to add sprites to the surface:

var drawCt = Ext.create({
    xtype: 'draw',
    renderTo: document.body,
    width: 400,
    height: 400
});

// If the surface name is not specified then 'main' will be used
var surface = drawCt.getSurface();

surface.add({
    type: 'rect',
    x: 50,
    y: 50,
    width: 100,
    height: 100,
    fillStyle: '#1F6D91'
});

surface.renderFrame();

Note: Changes to the sprites on a surface will be not be reflected in the DOM until you call the surface's renderFrame method. This must be done after adding, removing, or modifying sprites in order to see the changes on-screen.

From override Ext.draw.overrides.hittest.Surface: Adds hit testing methods to the Ext.draw.Surface. Included by the Ext.draw.plugin.SpriteEvents.

members.name: background
members.doc: Background sprite config of the surface.

members.name: dirty
members.doc: Indicates whether the surface needs to redraw.
members.short_doc: Indicates whether the surface needs to redraw. ...

members.name: flipRtlText
members.doc: If the surface is in the RTL mode, text will render with the RTL direction, but the alignment and position of the text won't change by default. Setting this config to 'true' will get text alignment and its position within a surface mirrored.
members.short_doc:
If the surface is in the RTL mode, text will render with the RTL direction,
but the alignment and position of the tex...

members.name: items
members.doc: Array of sprite instances.
members.short_doc: Array of sprite instances. ...

members.name: rect
members.doc: The [x, y, width, height] rect of the surface related to its container.

members.name: cls
deprecated
devicePixelRatio
members.doc: The reported device pixel density. devicePixelRatio is only supported from IE11, so we use deviceXDPI and logicalXDPI that are supported from IE6.
members.short_doc: The reported device pixel density. ...

members.name: dirtyPredecessorCount
emptyRect
isPendingRenderFrame
members.doc: This flag is used to indicate that predecessors surfaces that should render before this surface renders are dirty, and to call renderFrame when all predecessors have their renderFrame called (i.e. not dirty anymore). This flag indicates that current surface has surfaces that are yet to render before current surface can render. When all the predecessors surfaces have rendered, i.e. when dirtyPredecessorCount reaches zero,

members.name: isSurface
constructor
add
members.doc:
Add a Sprite to the surface. You can put any number of objects as the parameter. See Ext.draw.sprite.Sprite for the configuration object to be passed into this method.

For example:

drawContainer.getSurface().add({
    type: 'circle',
    fill: '#ffc',
    radius: 100,
    x: 100,
    y: 100
});
drawContainer.renderFrame();
members.short_doc: Add a Sprite to the surface. ...

members.name: applyBackground
applyItems
applyRect
clear
members.doc: Empty the surface content (without touching the sprites.)
members.short_doc: Empty the surface content (without touching the sprites.) ...

members.name: clearTransform
members.doc: Clears the current transformation state on the surface.
members.short_doc: Clears the current transformation state on the surface. ...

members.name: createItem
members.doc: Creates an item and appends it to the surface. Called as an internal method when calling add.
members.short_doc: Creates an item and appends it to the surface. ...

members.name: destroy
members.doc:
Destroys the surface. This is done by removing all components from it and also removing its reference to a DOM element.

For example:

 drawContainer.surface.destroy();
members.short_doc: Destroys the surface. ...

members.name: flatten
members.doc: Flattens the given drawing surfaces into a single image and returns an object containing the data (in the DataURL format) and the type (e.g. 'png' or 'svg') of that image.
members.short_doc:
Flattens the given drawing surfaces into a single image
and returns an object containing the data (in the DataURL for...

members.name: get
members.doc: Get the sprite by id or index. It will first try to find a sprite with the given id, otherwise will try to use the id as an index.
members.short_doc: Get the sprite by id or index. ...

members.name: getBBox
members.doc: Return the minimal bounding box that contains all the sprites bounding boxes in the given list of sprites.

return.type: {x: Number, y: Number, width: number, height: number}
return.name: return
return.html_type: {x: Number, y: Number, width: number, height: number}

members.short_doc:
Return the minimal bounding box that contains all the sprites bounding boxes
in the given list of sprites. ...

members.name: getEventXY
members.doc: Converts event's page coordinates into surface coordinates. Note: surface's x-coordinates always go LTR, regardless of RTL mode.
members.short_doc: Converts event's page coordinates into surface coordinates. ...

members.name: getFlipRtlText
members.doc: Returns the value of flipRtlText.
members.short_doc: Returns the value of flipRtlText. ...

members.name: getItems
members.doc: Returns the value of items.
members.short_doc: Returns the value of items. ...

members.name: getOwnerBody
members.doc: The body element of the chart or the draw container (doesn't include docked items like a legend). Draw Container is a Panel in Classic (to allow for docked items) and a Container in Modern, so the body is retrieved differently.
members.short_doc:
The body element of the chart or the draw container
(doesn't include docked items like a legend). ...

members.name: getRect
members.doc: Returns the value of rect.
members.short_doc: Returns the value of rect. ...

members.name: hitTest
members.doc: Performs a hit test on all sprites in the surface, returning the first matching one.

params.name: point
params.doc: A two-item array containing x and y coordinates of the point in surface coordinate system.

return.name: return
return.doc: A hit result object that contains more information about what exactly was hit or null if nothing was hit.

members.short_doc: Performs a hit test on all sprites in the surface, returning the first matching one. ...

members.name: hitTestEvent
members.doc: Performs a hit test on all sprites in the surface, returning the first matching one. Since hit testing is typically performed on mouse events, this convenience method converts event's page coordinates to surface coordinates before calling hitTest.

return.name: return
return.doc: A hit result object that contains more information about what exactly was hit or null if nothing was hit.

members.short_doc: Performs a hit test on all sprites in the surface, returning the first matching one. ...

members.name: onAdd
members.doc: Invoked when a sprite is added to the surface.
members.short_doc: Invoked when a sprite is added to the surface. ...

members.name: orderByZIndex
members.doc: Order the items by their z-index if any of that has been changed since last sort.
members.short_doc: Order the items by their z-index if any of that has been changed since last sort. ...

members.name: remove
members.doc:
Remove a given sprite from the surface, optionally destroying the sprite in the process. You can also call the sprite's own remove method.

For example:

 drawContainer.surface.remove(sprite);
 // or...
 sprite.remove();
members.short_doc:
Remove a given sprite from the surface,
optionally destroying the sprite in the process. ...

members.name: removeAll
members.doc:
Remove all sprites from the surface, optionally destroying the sprites in the process.

For example:

drawContainer.getSurface('main').removeAll();
members.short_doc: Remove all sprites from the surface, optionally destroying the sprites in the process. ...

members.name: renderFrame
members.doc: Triggers the re-rendering of the canvas.
members.short_doc: Triggers the re-rendering of the canvas. ...

members.name: renderSprite
members.doc: Renders a single sprite into the surface. Do not call it from outside renderFrame method.

return.name: return
return.doc: returns false to stop the rendering to continue.

members.short_doc: Renders a single sprite into the surface. ...

members.name: repaint
members.doc: Force the element to redraw.
members.short_doc: Force the element to redraw. ...

members.name: resetTransform
members.doc: Reset the matrix of the surface.
members.short_doc: Reset the matrix of the surface. ...

members.name: roundPixel
members.doc: Round the number to align to the pixels on device.
members.short_doc: Round the number to align to the pixels on device. ...
